news_header: Boeing workers have accepted a new pay offer, ending a seven-week strike, with a 38% pay rise over four years.
news_text: Boeing workers voted to accept the company's latest pay offer, concluding a damaging seven-week strike that began on September 13. The new contract includes a 38% pay increase over four years and a one-time bonus of $12,000. The International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers reported that 59% of striking workers approved the deal. Boeing's CEO emphasized the need to return to excellence, while the strike has cost the company nearly $10 billion. The situation has been serious enough to attract attention from the White House, with the acting Labor Secretary involved in negotiations.
